quiz.question: Which law describes the relationship between pressure, temperature, and volume for gases at low density?
Which scientific law explains how reaction rates depend on concentration and rate constants?
Which empirical law relates stellar luminosity roughly to a power of stellar mass on the main sequence?
What law relates the force needed to extend or compress a spring to the displacement?
Which law in thermodynamics states entropy approaches a constant as temperature approaches absolute zero?
Which concept explains anomalies in planetary precession resolved by general relativity?
options: Perihelion precession of Mercury explained by general relativity
quiz.answer: Perihelion precession of Mercury explained by general relativity

quiz.question: What theory explains why solids, liquids, and gases have different macroscopic behavior from particle motion?
Who formulated the laws of planetary motion using Tycho Brahe's observations?
Which relation predicts the entropy of an ideal gas in terms of volume, energy, and particle number constants?
Which law explains that pressure in a fluid decreases as the speed of the fluid increases?
Which empirical law approximates the relation between pressure and vapor pressure of a solution?
Which law quantifies tunneling decay rates in nuclear alpha decay using barrier penetration?
Which theory established that cells are the basic unit of life?
Which law describes how osmotic pressure depends on solute concentration and temperature?
Which law describes the empirical steep power-law relation in many natural networks and distributions?
